benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Tests cover creation with valid payload across TC01–TC05.
POST - Invalid Payload: Tests cover missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), and unsafe input (TC14).
POST - Duplicate Submission: TC23 ensures no duplicate BlockingState entries are created.
POST - Large Payloads: TC20 covers handling of large BlockingState payloads near payload size limits.
POST - Validation & Edge Cases: Tests cover invalid accountId (TC07), missing header (TC08), edge cases: empty pluginProperty (TC15), max field lengths (TC16), min values (TC17).
POST - Query Parameters & Optional Headers: TC02, TC03, TC04, TC18 validate handling of requestedDate and pluginProperty variations.
POST - Server Error Handling: TC12 (db unavailable) and TC22 (plugin service unavailable) validate 503 responses.
POST - Authorization: TC11 validates 401 unauthorized access.
Security - SQL Injection: TC13 tests injection in accountId.
Security - Malicious Payload: TC14 tests unsafe input handling.
Integration & Plugins: TC21 validates pluginProperty interaction with plugin system.
Edge & Regression: TC15, TC16, TC17, TC23, TC24 cover edge and regression scenarios.
Performance: TC25 (high concurrency) and TC26 (under load) exercise performance and concurrency aspects.
Accessibility: TC27 validates accessibility of API documentation and error messages.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or rate-limiting behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
403 Forbidden: No test specifically asserting 403 for insufficient permissions (only 401 is tested).
500 Internal Server Error: No test for 500-level failure (only 503 used).
Content-Type Validation: No tests for unsupported content-type or validation errors related to content-type.
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden when user lacks required permissions.
Add 500 Internal Server Error test cases in addition to 503 (e.g., database or service failure causing 500).
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under burst traffic.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and conditional requests.
Add tests for invalid Content-Type header (e.g., application/xml) and 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Consider tests for concurrency beyond 100 requests to stress-test the system; measure timeouts and SLA compliance.
